Text: The resemblance is quite good, don't you think?

The one speaking is a golden-haired elf of startling
beauty, looking at a piece of paper.

The paper is a wanted poster. On it is a drawing of
Shadow in his signature black coat.

Shadow, sworn enemy of the kingdom. Wanted for
indiscriminate homicide, criminal confinement,
arson, robbery... What a horrible person.
In the words of our lord...

"We gladly accept all the sins of this world.
But know that it will change nothing."
"For we..."
"...will accomplish what we set out to do."
Those are fine words.
Indeed.
The wanted poster turns to ash under Alpha's gaze.

I had always thought of us as being on the side of
good. But perhaps he felt differently…
We must also match his resolve.
Assemble all of the available Seven Shadows.

Looks like school's gonna be closed all the way into
summer break...
Hey, what's up?

I was told I could find you here... I need to talk to
you about something...
Um...thank you for the other day.
Eh, it was nothing.
No, that's not true. If it hadn't been for you, I...
It's fine, don't worry about it.

I have something to tell you... I've decided to study
abroad. In Laugus.
The college town... That's awesome.

There's something I have to do. But I don't know
enough to do it now.
Also...
She turns toward the school with a sad face.
There's no longer any reason for me to be here.
I'll see. Well, do your best out there.
Indeed.
I...had hoped I could speak with you more...
Sure. We'll catch up again sometime.
Yes, see you then.

The pink-haired girl smiles and walks to her
carriage.
Oh, hold up a sec.
Yes?
She turns back as Cid calls out to her.
Can I ask what it is you need to do?
Sherry smiles nervously at the question.
...It’s a secret.
Gotcha.

But...if all of this ever ends, will you listen to
what I have to say?
Sure.
...Well, be seeing you.
Yeah.

The two of them smile, then turn and walk their
separate ways.
I swear that I will...

The girl's whisper reaches the boy's ear on a sudden
gust of wind.

Though that soft utterance was meant for no one else,
it appears the boy caught every word of it.
He keeps walking as if nothing happened.
Neither of them turn back.
